triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the core platforms that form swarms, reviewed extensively throughout the paper.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics principles are fundamental to the design and operation of UAV swarms covered in this review.

triples.name: Swarm behaviour
triples.relevance: Collective swarm behavior is essential to understanding how UAV swarms coordinate and function effectively.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning is critical for trajectory and path planning in UAV swarms, a key aspect of the review.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: Navigation enables UAVs to determine position and plan paths, essential capabilities for swarm missions.

triples.name: Simultaneous localization and mapping
triples.relevance: SLAM is a localization technique enabling UAV swarms to autonomously map and navigate unknown environments.

triples.name: Distributed computing
triples.relevance: Distributed computing principles underpin the decentralized communication and coordination architecture of UAV swarms.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent system theory is fundamental to understanding task coordination and cooperation in UAV swarms.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: Autonomous robots form the basis for UAVs that operate independently within swarms without continuous human control.

triples.name: Swarm intelligence
triples.relevance: Swarm intelligence principles are applied to develop decentralized algorithms enabling UAV swarms to make collective decisions.
